Author: Sean S.
Title: Great aftermarket mirror and easy to install
Body: I've been using this mirror for a week and I'm quite happy with it.What I like:- The camera/functionality is great right out of the box.- Installation was easy. I purchased the hardwire kit, and the cable was long enough for a 2004 Scion xB. The reverse wire, however, was not, but that's because the Scion's reverse light is in a weird place and not a fault in the kit. I ran an extra few feet of wire to solve that problem.- The hardwire kit comes with multiple fuse jumpers to accommodate whichever type your car uses.- The display image is bright.- I haven't encountered any problems with camera glare, and the HDR seems to perform well at night and when driving directly into/away from the sun.- The installation video provided general information and wasn't too "vehicle specific."This mirror is WIDE, and if your cabin is narrow, it may interfere with your driver/passenger visors. Fortunately, the mounting bracket I got allowed me to maneuver the mirror into a position that's just out of the way enough that I'm able to lower both visors without any issue. My Scion is a small car, so if this mirror works for it, it will probably work for most.The few things I'd change:- The default driving impact sensitivity (that determines when the camera saves a recording) is very high. Driving over even moderately bumpy roads triggers the "save recording" function. Even after changing it to the least sensitive position, driving over railroad tracks or hitting bumps in the road saves the recording.- The mirror displays messages (like "Calibration complete") in a large grey box in the center of the mirror that's a bit distracting when driving since it covers the middle of the rear-view image. I'd prefer something in a corner instead. Fortunately, the messages are only displayed briefly, so they don't block the view for long.I didn't want to have the mirror strapped to my existing mirror, so I purchased a mirror installation bracket/back plate. I couldn't find specs on the bolt pattern for this mirror, so I took a chance. The bracket I picked didn't have the correct bolt pattern, but it only took about 5 minutes to measure, mark, and drill four 1/16" holes in the bracket.To mount the mirror this way, you'll need to peel back the rubber strips on the back of the mirror mounting plates, which will reveal four, small screws. Remove them and discard the plastic mounting pieces, then use the screws to attach the mirror to the bracket. Voila!

Title: Great camera, but does NOT come with parking feature.
Body: Overall, I like this dash camera.  The image quality is great, the build quality is great, and it has more features than I care to even mention, but among the basics it has its own GPS antenna, dual cameras, and voice control (!).  It also has a bunch of "help you drive" features which I'll likely never use, but they're there if you want them.  It's fairly easy to navigate the UI, and there's also an app to use as well.  I really didn't get into the app, because for me it's easier to plug the SD card into my computer and extract the files I need that way.Installation is...well, FAIRLY easy, but it is a bit tedious to mount the rear camera, depending on where you put it and how your car is set up.  In all, it works really well, and I can't imagine someone not being very happy with this.My only complaint is the fact it doesn't come with the parking feature as stated in the description.  It's a ~$25 add-on feature that you have to purchase separately (B0BM9JL327).  I don't know why this always seems to be an add-on feature; it makes it feel like the micro-transaction video game world has come into real life.  I really don't know who wouldn't want the parking monitor feature, it seems really silly not to have it, and for the life of me I can't imagine why it's not included with the unit itself.Aside from that little omission, the cam itself is great.  Good image, good build, and easy to use.  I recommend it, but don't forget the parking monitor add-on.  4 stars.

Author: K. Taylor
Title: Excellent
Body: Excellent. I've tested a couple of these mirror-mounted dashcams from Azdome over the past couple of years, and I've been really impressed with the quality of their products. I believe the PG17 is slightly larger than the last model I tested, with a better rear view camera, a larger screen with a better field of view and a bunch of little extras I've never seen before, like lane departure warnings (though it's possible I just missed that feature on the last model).It's pretty easy to set up the camera. The only challenging part of the installation was running the cable back through the vehicle to the backup camera. I always thought this was a bit of a pain, and I preferred a wireless rear camera, but after testing a few models I've decided that I prefer the zero lag or a wired model. Even a fraction of a second of latency over a wireless connection can get confusing while reversing, but a wired camera has instant transmission.All in all, very impressive. Azdome make great devices, and they only get better every year.

Author: S
Title: Feature-Rich Mirror Dash Cam with Excellent Image Quality and Driver Assistance
Body: The AZDOME PG17 Max offers a major upgrade for drivers seeking both safety and clarity. It captures ultra-clear footage with its 4K front and 2.5K rear cameras, displayed on a 12-inch touchscreen mirror that mounts easily over the OEM mirror. Setup is straightforward, and the pre-installed 64GB card gets you recording right away.Key highlights include built-in ADAS (Forward Collision, Pedestrian Warning, Lane Departure alerts) and enhanced BSD and LCA functions, improving situational awareness during lane changes and reversing. The 5.8GHz Wi-Fi ensures quick video downloads through the AZDOME app, while 10 voice commands allow for easy hands-free control.Video quality is consistently praised as crisp and detailed, both day and night. The included GPS records driving routes and speeds, and the system supports 24-hour parking monitoring (hardwire kit sold separately). Minor limitations mentioned include a lack of built-in mirror flip for some setups, but overall satisfaction is very high. A great option for upgrading both security and driving convenience. :)
